a0.name: AUTHORITY
a0.desc: The ability to intimidate or control others through your position as a lawman. Cops can use Authority to question suspects, arrest wrongdooers, and defend innocents. Also can call on the forces of the law and government to get what he wants

a1.name: CHARISMATIC LEADERSHIP
a1.desc: This skill allows the Rocker to sway crowds, control, inite and charm large number of people.

a2.name: COMBAT SENSE
a2.desc: Allow the Solo to perceive danger, notice traps, and have almost unearthly ability to avoid harm.

a3.name: CREDIBILITY
a3.desc: This is the ability to be believed, convincing people to give you information or get you into where the story is really happening.

a4.name: SURVIVAL INSTINCT
a4.desc: Ability to survive. Whether you are in a hostile environment or the wilderness or lacking food or water or your life is in danger, the higher this ability the more you'll survive it.

a5.name: INTERFACE
a5.desc: Ability to interface with any hardware/Net comm. Netrunners add this to their Programming, and System Knowledge, as they pertain to computers and communications

a6.name: JURY RIG
a6.desc: This skill allows you to repair or construct equipment using items and supplies from salvaged parts and junk most people would not think to use.

a7.name: MEDICAL TECH
a7.desc: This is the skill used to perform major surgery and medical repairs/heals.

a8.name: RESOURCES
a8.desc: Corporate's ability to command corporation resources. Include bodyguards, money, corporate secrets...

a9.name: STREETDEAL
a9.desc: This is the ability to deal with the underground information network. Whether to make a deal in the black market, to uncover missing persons or things, anything that goes in the undergrounds nowaday.

a10.name: PERSONAL GROOMING
a10.desc: This is the skill of knowing proper grooming, hair styling, etc., to maximize your physical attractiveness. Use of this skill allows players to increase their Attractiveness, and thus their chances of successful Relationships or Persuasion.

a11.name: WARDROBE & STYLE
a11.desc: The skill of knowing the right clothes to wear, when to wear them, and how to look cool even in a spacesuit.

a12.name: ENDURANCE
a12.desc: This is the ability to withstand pain or hardship, particularly over long periods of time, by knowing the best ways to conserve strength and energy. Endurance Skill checks would be made whenever a character must continue to be active a long period without food, sleep or water

a13.name: STRENGTH FEAT
a13.desc: The user of this skill has practiced the art of bending bars, crushing objects, ripping phone books apart and other useful parlor tricks.

a14.name: SWIMMING
a14.desc: This skill is require to know how to swim

a15.name: INTERROGATION
a15.desc: The skill of drawing information from subject and forcing his secrets into open

a16.name: INTIMIDATE
a16.desc: The skill of getting people to do what you want by forcing personality or physical coercion

a17.name: ORATORY
a17.desc: The skill of public speaking. This also covers the use of Rhetoric

a18.name: RESIST TORTURE/DRUGS
a18.desc: Characters with this skill are especially toughened against interrogation, torture and mind control drugs. A successful use of this skill will automatically increase the difficulty of any Interrogation attempt made by another guy by one level.

a19.name: STREETWISE
a19.desc: The knowledge of the 'seamy' ways of life - where to get illegal and contraband things, how to talk to the criminal environment, and avoiding bad situations in bad neighborhoods.

a20.name: HUMAN PERCEPTION
a20.desc: The skill of detecting any evasions, moods and other emotional clues from others.

a21.name: INTERVIEW
a21.desc: The skill of eliciting interesting anecdotes from interview subject. This information will be of a more non-specific and personal nature rather than specific knowledge (distinguishing this skill from the skill Interrogation, where the user is trying to extract exact information.

a22.name: LEADERSHIP
a22.desc: The skill of leading and convincing people to follow you.

a23.name: SEDUCTION
a23.desc: The skill of forming and maintaining romantic relationships (this includes your abilities as a lover). This skill may be used to determine whether or not players can form relationships with other non-players characters and the intensity of these relationships.

a24.name: SOCIAL
a24.desc: The ability to deal with social situations, like knowing the right fork to use or when not to tell the joke about farmer's daughter and the traveling salesman.

a25.name: PERSUASION & FAST TALK
a25.desc: The ability to talk others into doing what you want. This may be used individually or on large groups

a26.name: PERFORM
a26.desc: The skill of trained acting, singing, etc.

a27.name: ACCOUNTING
a27.desc: The ability to balance books (or create false books), juggle numbers, create budgets and handle day to day business operations

a28.name: ANTHROPOLOGY
a28.desc: The knowlege of human Culture, habits and customs. Unlike Streetwise (which covers only the culture of the Street), or Social (which covers only waht you should do in a given situation), this covers general customs and background of a culture.

a29.name: AWARENESS /NOTICE
a29.desc: This is equivalent of a 'trained observer' skill, allowing characters to notice or be aware of clues, shadowers and other events. Players without skill may only use their Intelligence Stat. Players of any Role should get a bonus if the Awareness task directly relates to their Special Ability; if a Medtech gets a fairly good Awareness roll, they may not realize they are walking into an ambush, but they will notice that the 'Traitor' is sweating profusely.

a30.name: BIOLOGY
a30.desc: The required skills for Doing any bio-research or bio modification. General knowlege of animals plants and other biological systems

a31.name: BOTANY
a31.desc: The general knowlege of plants and plants identification

a32.name: CHEMISTRY
a32.desc: The required skill for mixing chemicals various compounds

a33.name: COMPOSITION
a33.desc: The required skill for writing songs, articles, or stories.

a34.name: DIAGNOSE ILLNESS
a34.desc: The skill of clinically diagnosing symptoms and medical problems.

a35.name: EDUCATION
a35.desc: This skill is the equivalent of a basic public school education, allowing you to know how to read, write, use basic math, and know enough history to get by.

a36.name: GAMBLE
a36.desc: The skill on knowing how to make bets, figure odds, and play games of chance successfully. As any professional gambler knows, this is not a luck skill.

a37.name: GEOLOGY
a37.desc: A functional knowlege of rocks, minerals and geologic structures.

a38.name: HIDE/EVADE
a38.desc: The skill of losing pursuers, covering tracks and otherwise evading people on your trail.

a39.name: HISTORY
a39.desc: The knowlege of facts and figures of past events. In game play, this might be used to determine if a character is familiar with a particular clue related to past event.

a40.name: LIBRARY SEARCH
a40.desc: The skill of using databases, DataTermï¿½, libraries and other compiled information sources to find facts.  (Google search)

a41.name: MATHEMATICS
a41.desc: The skill of understanding calculations and mathematical formulas

a42.name: PHYSICS
a42.desc: The ability to calculate physical principles, like gas pressures, mechanical energies, etc.

a43.name: PROGRAMMING
a43.desc: The required skill to write programs and reprogram computer system. This skill does not allow players to actually do repairs on a computer (this requires Electronics).

a44.name: SHADOW/TRACK
a44.desc: The skill of shadowing and following people. This skill is primary used in urban or inhabited areas rather than in wilderness (where the skill of Survival incorporates tracking game in the wilds

a45a.name: STOCK MARKET
a45a.desc: Ability to make money from the stock market and how well can you read the charts.

a45.name: SYSTEM KNOWLEDGE
a45.desc: Basic knowledge of the geography of the Net, it's lore and history, as well as knowledge of the important computer systems, their strengths and their weaknesses.

a46.name: TEACHING
a46.desc: The skill of imparting knowledge to someone (if you don't think this is skill, you ought tot try is someone). Players may not teach any skill unless they have higher skill levels, in both teaching, and the skill(s) being taught, than the student

a47.name: WILDERNESS SURVIVAL
a47.desc: The required skill for knowing how to survive in the wild.

a48.name: ZOOLOGY
a48.desc: Knowlege of lifeforms, biological processes and their relation to the environment

a49.name: ARCHERY
a49.desc: The skill required to use bows, crossbows and other arrow-based ranged weapons

a50.name: ATHLETICS
a50.desc: This skill is required for accurate throwing, climbing, and balancing.

a51.name: BRAWLING
a51.desc: Brawling is the skill of fighting man to man with fist, feet and other parts of the body

a52.name: DANCE
a52.desc: The specific skill needed to become a professional dancer

a53.name: DODGE & ESCAPE
a53.desc: This skill is required to dodge attacks and escape grapples and holds.

a54.name: DRIVING
a54.desc: Pilot all ground vehicles like cars, motorcycles, tanks.

a55.name: FENCING
a55.desc: The mastery of the sword rapier and monoblades

a56.name: HANDGUN
a56.desc: You must have this skill to effectively use handguns of any type, including cyberware types.

a57.name: HEAVY WEAPONS
a57.desc: The required skill for using grenade launchers, autocannon, mortars, heavy machine guns, missiles and rocket launchers.

a58.name: MELEE
a58.desc: the ability to use knives, axes, clubs and other hand to hand weapons in combat.

a59.name: MOTORCYCLE
a59.desc: The required skill to operate motorcycles, and other two and three-wheeled vehicles

a60.name: OPERATE HVY. MACHINERY
a60.desc: The required skill to operate tractors, treaded vehicles, extremely large trucks and construction equip

a61.name: PILOT GYRO
a61.desc: he ability to pilot all types of rotorwing aircraft, including gyros, copters and Ospreys

a62.name: PILOT FIXED WING
a62.desc: The ability to pilot fixed wing jets and light aircraft. Ospreys may be flown with this skill, but not only in the straight ahead (non-hover) mode

a63.name: PILOT DIRIGIBLE
a63.desc: The ability to pilot all lighter than air vehicles, including cargo dirigibles, blimps and powered balloons.

a64.name: PILOT VECT. THRUST VEHICLE
a64.desc: The skill of piloting all types of vectored thrust vehicles, and AV-4, 6 and 7 vehicles.

a65.name: RIFLE
a65.desc: You must have this skill to use rifle/shotguns effectively

a66.name: STEALTH
a66.desc: The skill of hiding in shadows, moving silently, evading guards, etc

a67.name: SUBMACHINEGUN
a67.desc: You must have this skill to use any type of submachine gun effectively

a68.name: AERO TECH
a68.desc: The required skill for repairing fixed wing aircraft, including Ospreys, jets, and light aircraft

a69.name: AV TECH
a69.desc: The required skill for repairing all aerodyne vehicles

a70.name: BASIC TECH
a70.desc: The required skill for building or repairing simple mechanical and electrical devices, such as car engines, Toasters, etc...

a71.name: CRYOTANK OPERATION
a71.desc: The ability to cut into a living thing and remove, implant, or make repairs.

a72.name: CYBERDECK DESIGN
a72.desc: The required skill for designing cyberdecks.

a73.name: CYBERTECH
a73.desc: The required skill for repairing and maintaining cyberware.

a74.name: DEMOLITIONS
a74.desc: This skill allows the character to be knowledgeable in the use of explosives, as well as knowing the best explosives to use for which jobs, how to set times and detonators, and how much explosives to use to accomplish a desired result.

a75.name: DISGUISE
a75.desc: The skill of disguising yourself to resemble someone else, whether real or fictitious.

a76.name: ELECTRONICS
a76.desc: The required skill for maintaining, repairing and modifying electronic instruments such as computers, personal electronics hardware, electronic security systems, cameras and monitors.

a77.name: ELECTRONIC SECURITY
a77.desc: The skill of installing or countering electronic eyes, electronic locks, bugs and tracers, security cameras, pressure plates, etc.

a78.name: FIRST AID
a78.desc: This skill allows the user to bind wounds, stop bleeding, and revive a stunned patient.

a79.name: FORGERY
a79.desc: The skill of copying and creating false documents and identifications. This skill Forgery also be applied to the detection of same; if you can fake it, you can usually tell a fake as well.

a80.name: GYRO TECH
a80.desc: The skill or repairing and maintaining rotorwing aircraft such as helicopters and ospreys.

a81.name: PAINT OR DRAW
a81.desc: The skill of producing professional drawings.

a82.name: PHOTO & FILM
a82.desc: The skill of producing professional caliber photographs or video.

a83.name: PHARMACEUTICALS
a83.desc: The skill of designing and manufacturing drugs and medicines. (Chemistry is required)

a84.name: PICK LOCK
a84.desc: The skill required to pick locks and break into sealed containers and rooms.

a85.name: PICK POCKET
a85.desc: The required skill for picking pockets without being noticed, as well as 'shoplifting' small items. For ideas on levels of ability see Pick Lock. This also covers Sleight of Hand, the skill of making small objects disappear and reappear by using misdirection, nimble hand and finger movements, and other tricks.

a86.name: PLAY INSTRUMENT
a86.desc: The skill of knowing how to play musical instruments

a87.name: WEAPONSMITH
a87.desc: The skill for repairing and maintaining weapons.
